meanings.definition: In a greedy or voracious manner.
meanings.sent1: The hungry squirrel reedily devoured the nuts in the park.
meanings.sent2: She looked reedily at the delicious cake on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat reedily eyed the fish in the bowl, hoping for a chance to snatch it.
meanings.sent4: The treasure hunters reedily searched through the ancient ruins for hidden riches.
meanings.sent5: The child reedily grabbed all the candies from the jar before anyone else could take them.

meanings.sent1: The reedily curious puppy explored every corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: She was reedily waiting for the results of her exam.
meanings.sent3: The reedily enthusiastic fans cheered loudly for their favorite team.
meanings.sent4: The reedily ambitious student worked hard to achieve top grades.
meanings.sent5: The reedily hopeful job applicant eagerly awaited the interview results.
